definition: to lift up (sth hanging down)/to raise (hem of skirt)/to pull up (sleeve)/to sprinkle (water with cupped hands)
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
to raise/to lift up (curtains, clothing etc)
to push aside (clothing, curtain etc) to reveal something/to toss aside
variant of 繚亂|缭乱[liao2 luan4]
to stir up trouble/to provoke angry exchange

sentences.english: I quickly sluiced my face with cold water.
sentences.chinese: 我撩着涼水洗了一把臉。

definition: trouble/disturbance/rumpus/flirty/coquettish/abbr. for 離騷|离骚[Li2 Sao1]/literary writings/smell of urine/foul smell/male (animal) (dialect)
(Internet slang) to form a hand heart using one's thumb and forefinger (or by using both hands)
to explain oneself/to express/to reveal one's thoughts or feelings/declaration/confession
(Internet slang) awkward conversation/to have a cringeworthy conversation
to pick up a girl/to get a girl
handsome high-powered businessman (a type of character in an eponymous genre of romantic fiction who typically has a soft spot for a girl of lower social status)
(sentence-final particle expressing exhortation)/(syllable filler in a song)
(final particle similar to 了[le5], indicating that sth is obvious)
